legacyPatterns.description: Uses WCF services with SOAP endpoints. WCF is not available in .NET Core/.NET 6+.
legacyPatterns.modernReplacement: gRPC, REST API with ASP.NET Core Web API, or HTTP clients

legacyPatterns.description: Uses System.Messaging for MSMQ. Windows-specific and not available in .NET Core/.NET 6+.
legacyPatterns.modernReplacement: Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or Azure Queue Storage

legacyPatterns.description: Legacy ASP.NET MVC framework dependent on System.Web and IIS.
Uses old-style MSBuild project format with verbose package references.
Uses legacy packages.config for NuGet package management.
Uses HttpContext.Session for cart storage. Not cloud-native or scalable.
legacyPatterns.modernReplacement: Distributed cache (Redis), cookies, or database-backed sessions

legacyPatterns.description: Tight coupling to System.Web namespace which doesn't exist in .NET Core/.NET 6+.

factors.notes: Requires rewriting service layer from WCF to REST API or gRPC
Need to replace with Azure Service Bus or similar cloud service
Standard migration path but requires view and controller updates

modernizationComplexity.reasoning: High complexity due to multiple legacy patterns (WCF, MSMQ) that require significant architectural changes. Medium-sized codebase with clear separation of concerns makes migration manageable.

architecture.pattern: Modern ASP.NET Core with REST APIs
architecture.frontend: ASP.NET Core MVC with Razor Pages
architecture.dataAccess: Repository pattern with potential EF Core

phases.name: Project Structure Modernization
tasks: Update NuGet packages to .NET 10 compatible versions

phases.name: Service Layer Migration
phases.description: Replace WCF with ASP.NET Core Web API
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core Web API project
Replace WCF-specific code with REST endpoints
Update client to use HTTP REST calls instead of WCF proxy

phases.name: Web Application Migration
phases.description: Migrate ASP.NET MVC 5 to ASP.NET Core MVC
tasks: Update Razor views for ASP.NET Core syntax
Replace Session with distributed cache or cookies

phases.name: Messaging Migration
phases.description: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
tasks: Set up Azure Service Bus namespace
Create OrderQueueService adapter for Service Bus

phases.name: Containerization
phases.description: Add Docker support and Azure Container Apps configuration
tasks: Create Dockerfiles for web app and API
Set up CI/CD pipeline for container deployment

phases.name: Testing and Deployment
phases.description: Validate and deploy to Azure Container Apps
tasks: Configure Azure resources (Container Apps, Service Bus)

risks.mitigation: Create abstraction layer before migration, test thoroughly
Use message queue abstraction, test with Azure Service Bus early
Implement distributed cache or stateless design with client-side storage
Review breaking changes documentation, test incrementally

recommendations: Start with service layer migration to unblock web app migration
Use feature flags to enable gradual rollout
Implement comprehensive integration tests before migration
Consider using Azure Service Bus early in development
Set up Azure Container Apps environment early for testing
Use .NET Upgrade Assistant as a starting point for project conversion
Maintain backward compatibility during transition period
benefits: Cloud-native architecture with Azure Container Apps
Reduced licensing costs (no Windows Server required)
Access to latest .NET features and improvements
